item.title: South Africa dismissed for its lowest ever T20 score as India sends ominous message to rivals
item.description: The rematch of last year's T20 World Cup final is dominated by India as South Africa is dismissed for just 74 runs.

item.title: Report finds 'shockingly low' government spend on preventing child removals
item.description: Only 15.6 per cent of national child protection funding goes towards family support services aimed at keeping families intact, a report has found. Advocates are urging the government to "invest in families, not crisis".

item.title: 'Integrity' of environmental approvals questioned in WA government's attempt to balance nature and industry in new laws
item.description: As WA's state development laws make their way through parliament, critics are worried about environmental approvals and concentration of power, but the government insists the changes mean more transparency.

item.title: Pet cam captures bull and horse sneaking into home of NT politician Andrew Mackay
item.description: An NT resident tells of discovering he had unexpected guests in his home, after his dogs were filmed nudging open a door and letting inside a pet bull and horse.

item.title: Volunteer WA firefighter with rare and aggressive cancer calls for compensation
item.description: Matthew Petch says firefighters like him are being left behind by an outdated compensation scheme and a lack of health screening.

item.title: Hannah Wilson has quit medicinal cannabis but has been relentlessly targeted by advertisements
item.description: Hannah Wilson says she found it shockingly easy to obtain a medicinal cannabis prescription, despite her history of schizophrenic psychosis.

item.title: Formal complaint filed to FIFA over Gianni Infantino's peace prize awarded to US president Donald Trump
item.description: A human rights organisation files an official complaint to FIFA over its peace prize awarded to US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Domestic violence offenders sentenced for calling victim-survivors from WA prisons
item.description: A WA District Court judge questions how family and domestic violence perpetrators were able to "persistently" contact their victims using a regional prison's phones.

item.title: Unknown number of homes and buildings destroyed in Capertee Valley bushfire
item.description: An unknown number of unoccupied homes and buildings have been destroyed in a bushfire burning in NSW's Capertee Valley near Lithgow. A high fire danger warning remains in place with conditions expected to get worse.

item.title: Tasmanian ministers access $45,000 in free NBL and AFL tickets in a year
item.description: Tasmanian government ministers have accessed more than $21,000 of free tickets to Tasmania JackJumpers games in the past 12 months, available as part of an agreement with the basketball club.

item.title: Rare brain illness could not stop Milly from making country netball history
item.description: A rare brain illness left Milly Brock unable to walk or speak, but eight months later, she was back leading her regional netball club on grand final day.

item.title: Houses destroyed in bushfire near St Helens as 'hundreds' flee to evacuation centre
item.description: At least two properties have been destroyed in a bushfire burning near St Helens, on Tasmania's upper east coast.

item.title: In Data Dreams: Art and AI at the MCA, 10 artists explore the impact of AI on contemporary life
item.description: Can you tell what's real and what's fake online? Data Dreams: Art and AI at the MCA, featuring a Kim Kardashian deepfake, looks at the impact of AI on everyday life

item.title: Dancing gorilla wins Comedy Wildlife Photo Awards 2025
item.description: The winning images pair talented nature photography with humour that often relies on capturing a moment at just the right time.

item.title: Wells says 'gut reaction' to travel claims fair but she has 'upheld' rules
item.description: Communications and Sports Minister Anika Wells accepts her taxpayer-funded travel claims have prompted a "gut reaction" in people.

item.title: Anika Wells answers questions over entitlements
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Testing on supermarket imported honey finds some is not all honey
item.description: Australian beekeepers are funding their own investigation into the authenticity of imported honey, with tests showing other products are being added.

item.title: Crucial koala corridors are dwindling in Sydney's south-west, conservationists warn
item.description: Key wildlife links between two of Sydney's major rivers are under threat from land clearing for housing, according to a koala conservation group.

item.title: Woman critically injured in alleged domestic violence attack in Sydney's south-west
item.description: A 36-year-old woman has been airlifted to Liverpool Hospital in critical condition. A man known to her has been charged with seven offences over the alleged attack.

item.title: AI to be trialled at Royal Perth Hospital in bid to reduce pressure on WA health system
item.description: A trial of artificial intelligence at Royal Perth Hospital is announced in an attempt to help health workers focus on patient care, as new data reveals WA's emergency departments are among the most stretched in the nation.

item.title: Timor-Leste remembers Indonesian invasion 50 years after military assault
item.description: Survivors still have clear memories of the invasion by Indonesia, as Timor-Leste this week commemorates the beginning of a brutal 24-year occupation.

item.title: Taliban arrests young men in Afghanistan for Peaky Blinders dress-up
item.description: Morality police in Afghanistan detain several influencers who have gone viral for dressing up as 1920s gangsters in the style of BBC series Peaky Blinders.

item.title: Melbourne nutrition influencer died from postpartum haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears
item.description: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

item.title: CFS firefighter Peter Curtis's 'great courage' remembered at funeral service
item.description: Peter Curtis, who died at a bushfire ground on SA's Eyre Peninsula last month, has been remembered as a loving husband, father and grandfather, and a firefighter who "led from the front" and was a "bloody good bloke to have around".

item.title: Four more teenagers charged over stabbing at Ellenbrook Secondary College
item.description: A 10th teenager is charged over an alleged premeditated gang attack at Ellenbrook Secondary College on Monday that left a student with stab wounds.

item.title: Stieglitz residents stay to defend homes amid bushfire near St Helens on Tasmania's east coast
item.description: As a bushfire rages on Tasmania's east coast, bayside resident Paul Worsteling shelters in his car, charging his phone while saltwater rains down on the roof.

item.title: From peacekeeping in Timor-Leste to PTSD in Afghanistan: The beauty and terror of being an official war artist
item.description: Australia has been sending artists to the frontline since World War I, with more than 50 local artists taking part since then. But what's it actually like to head into war armed with a paintbrush?

item.title: WA opposition blames police staffing levels for slow response to Boulder ambulance emergency
item.description: The WA Liberals say a slow police response to a violent incident involving St John Ambulance officers in the Goldfields is due to understaffing but the claim has been rejected by the police minister.

item.title: Tasmania's bushfire danger arrived suddenly. Here's how to prepare
item.description: Tasmania's bushfire season has suddenly arrived, with two catastrophes within days of each other. Here is how to prepare if one comes your way.

item.title: Defence briefs Pacific nations on China's naval flotilla but 'final destination' unknown
item.description: Australian Defence officials have been briefing Pacific nations about the formidable capabilities and weaponry of a Chinese naval flotilla in the region, which the ADF is continuing to monitor closely.

item.title: Coroner finds police action 'inadequate' in lead-up to murder-suicide
item.description: Lynette Thompson was set on fire by her partner who later committed suicide. A coroner wants NSW police to change their procedures in dealing with domestic violence.

item.title: Halls Creek man arrested after allegedly selling $45k worth of alcohol in dry WA communities
item.description: The man allegedly bought large quantities of beer, champagne and rum in Darwin before selling it in WA's Kimberley region.

item.title: Victim statements redacted in 2014 fatal SA freeway crash court hearing
item.description: The daughters of a man who died in a truck crash at the bottom of the South-Eastern Freeway in 2014 have their heavily redacted victim impact statements read aloud in court, more than 11 years after their father died.

item.title: Hundreds of men march against domestic violence in Alice Springs on Human Rights Day
item.description: Up to 300 men — and a similar number of women — have taken part in the annual Ingkintja Men's March Against Domestic Violence under the slogan End the silence! Stop the violence! in Alice Springs, coinciding with the International Human Rights Day.

item.title: Age verification errors see some under-16s retain access to banned social media platforms
item.description: It's day one of the social media ban, but dozens of parents have told the ABC their children have already been able to get around the restrictions.

item.title: New order banning supply of NSW North Coast green prawns a 'death knell' for industry
item.description: White spot disease in prawns has led the NSW government to issue a new, five-year control order which will ban the sale of green prawns caught in affected waters.

item.title: New crocodile management plan draws mixed response in north Queensland
item.description: The new management plan sees the expansion of crocodile removal zones across north and far north Queensland. Some say it will not increase safety without better community education.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: North Melbourne expect to land former number one AFLW draft pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner
item.description: North Melbourne have been unable to trade for Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner but the two-time defending AFLW premiers are still confident they'll secure the former number one draft pick.

item.title: Climate crisis is threatening disabled Australians' access to nature
item.description: From bushfires and decreasing air quality to flooding and erosion, climate change is threatening our relationship with nature, and people with disability are being disproportionately impacted.

item.title: Inquest into toddler's septic tank death sparks calls for improved maintenance in remote NT public housing
item.description: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

item.title: Australia records highest number of Indigenous deaths in custody since 1979
item.description: Australia has recorded the highest number of Indigenous deaths in custody since 1979. Experts say over-incarceration remains a national crisis and prisons are neglecting the physical and mental health of vulnerable people.

item.title: Marco Rubio orders US State Department to revert to Times New Roman font, calling Calibri adoption 'wasteful'
item.description: In a leaked internal cable, Secretary of State Marco Rubio calls the department's decision to adopt Calibri in 2023 a "wasteful" diversity move.

item.title: US backs Japan in dispute with China over radar incident as tensions escalate
item.description: China and Japan have given differing accounts of the incident, which was a major escalation in tensions between the two nations.

item.title: Nearly 200 children conceived from sperm donor with increased cancer risk
item.description: Between 2006 and 2022, the man's sperm was sold to 67 clinics in 14 countries, whereas 99 children were fathered by the donor in Denmark alone.

item.title: US plans to order foreign tourists, including Australians, to disclose social media histories
item.description: Applicants would also have to submit phone numbers, email addresses, personal details of family members and biometric information under the plan.

item.title: Half a million people flee Thailand–Cambodia border conflict as Trump moves to intervene again
item.description: Thailand has rejected Donald Trump's plan to call both sides to achieve peace, with half a million people forced to flee the fighting along the border.

item.title: Landmark case aims to force betting agencies to return gambled stolen millions
item.description: A landmark legal case against three of Australia's biggest online betting agencies has been filed in the Federal Court, aimed at recovering millions of dollars' worth of stolen money that was gambled away and kept by corporate bookmakers.

item.title: Nationals MP's high family travel bill highlights generous rules
item.description: Calls for politicians' family travel entitlements to be tightened are growing, as analysis shows one Nationals MP was allowed to charge taxpayers more than $80,000 to fly his spouse to and from Canberra 27 times in two years.

item.title: Australia's energy rule-maker calls for 'Netflix-like' power charges
item.description: Australians' electricity bills have become a nightmare of complexity and high prices. An energy regulator says subscription fees could be an answer.

item.title: Tasmania's bushfires may be an indication of what's to come this summer
item.description: Just days into summer, Tasmania is battling bushfires and their presence can be linked back to a rare spike in temperatures above Antarctica back in September.

item.title: Why Ashton Hurn may, or may not, succeed as SA Liberal leader
item.description: Ashton Hurn now has the job she said she didn't want. Could she be the leader the South Australian Liberal Party needs?

item.title: Third time is the charm as long-running soap opera Neighbours wraps up, again
item.description: After more than 40 years on air, the final credits will roll on the iconic soap Neighbours — again.

item.title: NSW government acquires two outback stations to convert into national parks
item.description: Two outback stations 800 kilometres west of Sydney are purchased by the state government in an effort to protect the environment.

item.title: Australia's education system 'highly segregated' says former minister Susan Close
item.description: South Australia's former deputy premier Susan Close has called out what she describes as "extreme" socio-economic segregation in Australian schools.

item.title: Australia's grand social media experiment is finally live. Teens say nothing has changed
item.description: After a year of waiting, Australia's world-leading laws to block kids from accessing social media are officially enacted. But the teens they're meant to impact say not much has actually changed.

item.title: Fears of 'another Cronulla riot' 20 years on from violence at beach
item.description: Two decades on from the racially-fuelled brawls at Cronulla, experts warn something similar could happen amid anti-immigration rhetoric.

item.title: Households now need six-figure income to comfortably rent in any capital city
item.description: The average income needed to comfortably rent a median-priced home in any Australian capital city is now more than $112,000, according to new analysis.

item.title: National Library of Australia reveals its treasures with exhibition showcasing books from throughout history
item.description: The NLA has more than 10 million items, but they are all in storage. Now a new exhibition reveals a selection of its hidden treasures.

item.title: Mildura man Jordan Stewart Blair found guilty of rape, brutal assault of woman
item.description: Mildura man Jordan Stewart Blair has been found guilty of sexually assaulting a woman less than a day after he viciously bashed her in May, 2024.

item.title: US Republicans and Democrats push for Australian-style kids' social media ban
item.description: As Australians under 16 lose their social media accounts, influential Republicans and Democrats are pushing the US Congress to consider a similar ban for children under 13.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka adamant 'Battle of the Sexes' clash against Nick Kyrgios will help women's tennis
item.description: Aryna Sabalenka is adamant her upcoming clash against Nick Kyrgios will not prove to be a gimmick that damages women's tennis.

item.title: Cabinet ministers debate whether gas reservation plan can cut power prices as hoped
item.description: A long-awaited scheme to force east coast energy giants to set aside gas for Australian use is being finalised in down-to-the-wire negotiations between half a dozen cabinet ministers grappling with concerns it may not lower prices as much as hoped.

item.title: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief updates official declaration of interests to disclose defence link
item.description: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief Paul Brereton formally discloses his consulting work for the defence watchdog after the ABC reveals the links.

item.title: 'Zombie-proof' EV ad tops complaints list as social media cases rise
item.description: As more businesses look to do their own advertising, audience complaints for social media ads are growing.

item.title: Seasonal conditions lead to supersized strawberries in Australian stores
item.description: Seasonal conditions are leading to big berries this summer, with the fruit on the larger side in some regions because of a wetter spring.

item.title: US seizes oil tanker off coast of Venezuela, Donald Trump says
item.description: US President Donald Trump says the tanker is "the largest one ever seized".

item.title: Murray River water thieves hit with $558,000 fine
item.description: Jindalee Road Wines and its former manager have been penalised $558,000 for illegally tapping into an irrigation pipeline and stealing water.

item.title: From stacking supermarkets to 'chairman of everything', David Gonski exits uni leadership job
item.description: Best known for his review into schools funding, David Gonski feels optimistic about the future of education in Australia, despite the growing challenges posed by AI and funding pressures on universities.

item.title: Federal Court hears bid from Regis Resources to overturn protection order that stopped McPhillamys Gold Mine
item.description: Regis Resources argues the federal environment department was "uncritical" in accepting evidence about a First Nations Dreaming story that led to its proposed gold project being halted.

item.title: Tiwi Islands become 700,000-hectare Indigenous Protected Area under federal agreement
item.description: The agreement with the federal government sees the Tiwi Islands included in Australia's national parks and reserves system.

item.title: Why WA's housing crisis is proving a roadblock to easing family and domestic violence
item.description: The WA government is talking up its efforts to stamp out domestic and family violence, but there is one fundamental roadblock to alleviating the situation for women in crisis, and that is the state's housing crisis.

item.title: Egypt and Iran complain to FIFA over potential LGBTQ+ pride match at World Cup
item.description: Iran and Egypt's group stage clash at next year's FIFA World Cup in Seattle is set to be a celebration of LGBTQ+ pride, and both federations are not happy.

item.title: Threat eases from Stieglitz bushfire near St Helens on Tasmania's east coast
item.description: Firefighters have reopened access for residents of a bushfire-struck community on Tasmania's east coast.

item.title: Half Big Brother, half late-night talk show: The WNBA stars revolutionising sports media
item.description: The WNBA's 'StudBudz' are using live streaming to build a brand and community, while providing lessons in marketing women's sports.

item.title: Nicole Kidman to co-chair Met Gala with Beyoncé, Venus Williams and Anna Wintour
item.description: The museum also announced a gala host committee, chaired by designer Anthony Vaccarello and filmmaker Zoë Kravitz.

item.title: Greg Lynn arrives at court for appeal decision
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Walter Sofronoff loses appeal against finding he engaged in corrupt conduct during inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution
item.description: The man who led the inquiry into the criminal prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann loses his appeal to have serious corruption findings against him overturned.

item.title: US authorities seize Venezuela oil tanker
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Michigan fires football coach Sherrone Moore over 'inappropriate relationship' with staffer
item.description: Sherrone Moore's rollercoaster tenure with Michigan comes to an end midway through its second season as the college shows zero tolerance for his actions.

item.title: SA courts close amid escalating dispute over correctional services pay
item.description: Strike action involving prison officers has again escalated, forcing the closure of SA's major courts and causing disruptions to case hearings, which will now be rescheduled.

item.title: Superannuation giant HESTA hit with extra licence restrictions as APRA raises governance, risk concerns
item.description: APRA says the fallout of HESTA's planned outage led to a "severe, prolonged disruption" that caused direct harm to some of its 1.1 million members, in a damning assessment of the fund.

item.title: Collingwood employee resigns after alcohol-fuelled incident at Alice Springs training camp
item.description: A Collingwood employee hands in his resignation following an incident on an interstate trip that required an investigation by the club.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate remains at 4.3 per cent, but underemployment surges
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate holds steady at 4.3 per cent in November, but the underemployment rate jumps to 12-month high.

item.title: This Grand Designs Australia house cost $320k to build. Here's how its owners pulled it off
item.description: Bespoke architectural builds on small budgets may seem like an impossible housing dream, but James and Rita managed to turn their vision into a reality — without breaking the bank.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology makes major changes to $96.5m website after refresh backlash
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology has updated the rain radar, temperature information and warning displays on its new website in response to public feedback.

item.title: Aussie travellers who criticise US most at risk as Trump administration proposes social media disclosures
item.description: Australians travelling to the United States could soon face an unprecedented invasion of privacy, an international law expert has warned.

item.title: Italian cooking and its rituals get United Nations designation as World Heritage
item.description: Already loved around the world for its palate-pleasing tastes, UNESCO has now added the rituals surrounding Italian food preparation and consumption to its list of the world's traditional practices and expressions.

item.title: Four French nationals charged with stealing $10 million in luxury items from Canberra home
item.description: Police allege the men travelled to Australia to rob a Canberra home, stealing distinctive, luxury items.

item.title: Iceland becomes fifth country to boycott Eurovision 2026 over Israeli participation
item.description: Iceland has joined Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia in boycotting the competition in protest against Israel's participation in the song contest.

item.title: AC Milan Serie A Perth soccer game in serious doubt amid FIFA roadblock
item.description: Plans to host seven-time European champions AC Milan in Perth for an Italian league game are in trouble, with growing concerns soccer's global governing body will not sign off on the event.

item.title: Sentence handed to Darwin fatal hit-and-run driver Jake Danby 'shocked public consciousness', appeal hears
item.description: The NT Court of Criminal Appeal has heard an appeal against the sentence for a 24-year-old driver who avoided a jail sentence after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his vehicle, killing one, and then boasting about it over text.

item.title: PM distances himself from politician spending rules amid Anika Wells controversy
item.description: Pressed on whether his government should review the rules that allow politicians to fly their families around the country in business class, the prime minister says his focus is on the social media ban.

item.title: States lash Commonwealth's revised public hospital funding offer
item.description: The prime minister wrote to states and territories this week, upping the Commonwealth's offer for public hospital funding.

item.title: The Golden Spurtle takes audiences into the heart of the World Porridge Making Championship
item.description: Every year, the Scottish town of Carrbridge hosts a porridge competition. Its contestants and chieftain are larger than life and celebrated in the new Aussie documentary The Golden Spurtle.

item.title: The two Navy officers breaking ground, heading towards Winter Paralympics
item.description: It has been 20 years since Australia sent a biathlete to the Winter Paralympics, but two serving Navy personnel are hoping to change this.

item.title: Coalition agrees to sweeping changes to NSW workers' compensation scheme
item.description: NSW Opposition Leader Kellie Sloane says changes to the state's workers' compensation scheme are an important "reset".

item.title: Antarctic science and logistics given $208m federal funding boost
item.description: The federal government has announced more than $200 million in additional funding over the next seven years for Antarctic science and logistics.

item.title: Blackwater massage therapist Donovan Webb charged with additional sexual assault offences
item.description: Blackwater massage therapist Donovan Webb has been charged with a further 40 counts of sexual assault alleged to have taken place during massage therapy sessions.

item.title: Man arrested for alleged murder of father-of-two Chris Robertson
item.description: Police have arrested a 30-year-old man for the alleged murder of Adelaide father-of-two Chris Robertson, who was found dead in a Lonsdale workshop in September.

item.title: Australian hooker Harry Grant awarded rugby league Golden Boot for 2025
item.description: New Zealand's Dylan Brown seemed a certainty to claim the Golden Boot as rugby league's best international player for 2025 but the Kiwi five-eighth has missed out in a stunning twist.

item.title: Queensland government moves to lift ban on political donations from property developers
item.description: The attorney-general said the proposed laws would level the political playing field, labelling the ban as a "gerrymander" by the former Labor government.

item.title: SA algal bloom testing shows positive signs ahead of peak summer temperatures
item.description: Authorities say the "best signs" in a "long time" have been observed in the latest round of monitoring of the state's algal bloom crisis.

item.title: China's huge trade surplus shows Trump failed to tame Beijing's export juggernaut
item.description: China's record breaking one trillion-dollar trade surplus shows Trump's tariffs have done little to tame Beijing's export juggernaut. In fact, they might have turbocharged it instead.

item.title: Victorian government's gas exploration plans in Gippsland and the Otways anger environmental groups
item.description: The Victorian government calls for tenders after it approved exploration licenses for two new gas projects in the Otway and Gippsland basins.

item.title: Ex-NRL star Jarryd Hayne applies to have civil damages case by rape accuser dismissed
item.description: Lawyers for the former NRL star seek to have a civil damages lawsuit against him dismissed, citing delays in the Supreme Court civil case.

item.title: Adult content creator Bonnie Blue will be banned from Bali after studio raid involving 14 Australians
item.description: A high-profile British adult content creator will be banned from Bali for 10 years after police raided a "studio" on the island, in which 14 Australians were found.

item.title: Two bushfires downgraded from emergency warnings in Bullsbrook and Kenwick in Perth
item.description: Fires in the city's north-east and south-east are downgraded to watch and act levels, while lives and homes remain possibly under threat.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Father of Michael Purse relieved as murderer Mark-Bry Leedham loses appeal against conviction
item.description: Jeffrey Purse says a court's decision to dismiss an appeal by his son's killer offers "some justice" for his family, as the search for Michael Purse's remains continues.

item.title: Tom Silvagni revealed as man from high-profile Victorian family convicted of rape
item.description: Tom Silvagni, the son of Carlton Football Club great Stephen Silvagni, can now be identified as the man last week found guilty of raping a woman in 2024, after a court lifted a restriction on publishing his name.

item.title: Six-ingredient rocky road is perfect for last-minute Christmas prep - ABC News
item.description: This milk chocolate rocky road is easy to make. It creates 12 large slices, perfect for gifting or dessert if you're bringing a plate.

item.title: Canberra man jailed for raping customer in mall art shop where he worked
item.description: A judge says the former art shop worker had a "complete disconnect between perception and reality" as she jails him for rape.

item.title: Motherhood and sport 'can co-exist': AOC offers cash incentives for Olympian mums
item.description: The Australian Olympic Committee hopes to keep more athletes in sport by offering cash incentives for women who return after having children, and tens of thousands of dollars for retiring Olympians.

item.title: Former Yipirinya School principal Gavin Morris handed suspended sentence for physically assaulting students
item.description: Gavin Morris, the former principal of Yipirinya School in Alice Springs, has received an 18-month suspended sentence for the aggravated assault of four students.

item.title: Court of Appeal details reasons behind quashing of Greg Lynn's murder conviction
item.description: The Victorian Court of Appeal ruled to overturn the former Jetstar pilot's murder conviction and ordered a new trial.

item.title: Barry O'Farrell expected to return as Wests Tigers chairman 10 days after shock sacking
item.description: The boardroom dramas at Wests Tigers take another turn with Barry O'Farrell and multiple other ousted independent directors expected to return to the club at the NRL's demand.

item.title: Milenko 'Gobesan' Snjegota found guilty but not criminally responsible of father's backyard murder
item.description: An Illawarra man living with diagnosed schizophrenia has been found guilty but not criminally responsible for murdering his father in February 2024.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: A bushfire burns in Bullsbrook in Perth's north.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NACC chief Brereton's claim recusal 'unnecessary' openly disputed by his deputies
item.description: The National Anti-Corruption Commission's chief personally drafted lines in a media release saying his recusal from defence cases was "unnecessary". His deputies have publicly disagreed.

item.title: Lawyers defend Tanya Plibersek's part protection of McPhillamys mine site from development
item.description: Lawyers for former federal environment minister Tanya Plibersek have defended the Commonwealth's acceptance of the Blue Banded Bee Dreaming to protect part of a gold mine site from development.

item.title: Regulator 'disappointed' over Tasmanian salmon industry's antibiotic plan, emails show
item.description: A salmon company gave Tasmanian authorities a week's notice before it planned to start using a new antibiotic in the state's waterways to combat a disease outbreak, sparking a strong rebuke from the industry regulator.

item.title: Bookkeeper Karen Anne Webb given suspended sentence for stealing $163,000 from Mount Barker employer
item.description: The Albany Magistrates Court heard the woman had transferred the money to her personal account in smaller amounts over 15 months.

item.title: Luke Anthony Shaw given 23-year prison sentence for 2022 murder of David Wayne Jenkins
item.description: A northern Tasmanian man has been sentenced to more than two decades in prison for the "unnecessary and pointless" 2022 stabbing death of another man.

item.title: Gas company Beetaloo Energy clears final hurdle for fracking in the Beetaloo Basin
item.description: Major global oil and gas companies are expressing "serious interest" in the Beetaloo Basin for the first time, one analyst says, now that Beetaloo Energy has reached a final investment decision and committed to developing its fracking project.

item.title: Living seawalls bringing life back into harbours
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: More than 3,000 aged care patients stuck in hospital beds, new national figures show
item.description: State health ministers will today enter their final meeting of the year with their federal counterpart armed with figures showing a 25 per cent increase in just three months of aged care patients stranded in hospitals.

item.title: NATO chief Mark Rutte tells allies: 'We are Russia's next target'
item.description: Mark Rutte said Moscow could be ready to use military force against NATO in five years, adding Europe should be prepared for war comparable to what "our grandparents and great-grandparents endured".

item.title: Myanmar army bombs hospital in Rakhine state killing at least 31 people
item.description: The latest strike reportedly killed multiple members of the same family and a months-old infant.

item.title: TIME magazine names 'The Architects of AI' as 2025 Person of the Year, confirming leak to betting markets
item.description: The magazine cites the tremendous technological advances made by the artificial intelligence industry over the past year in bringing on the age of "thinking machines".

item.title: Alleged co-owners of Goa nightclub Birch by Romeo Lane detained in Thailand following fire that killed 25 people
item.description: The blaze killed 25 people, with authorities arresting six other people in the case so far.

item.title: Amnesty International report finds Hamas committed crimes against humanity with October 7 attacks
item.description: Amnesty's investigation finds Hamas's crimes against humanity included murder, extermination, imprisonment, torture, rape and other inhumane acts, including during its time holding more than 250 people hostage.

item.title: US judge orders Kilmar Abrego Garcia be released from ICE detention
item.description: The case has become a key test of Donald Trump's immigration crackdown after Mr Abrego Garcia was wrongfully deported to El Salvador.

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy proposes Ukrainian referendum on disputed territory as Donald Trump tires of meetings
item.description: Ukraine has proposed a vote on disputed territory in an updated version of the US-led peace plan to end Russia's war.

item.title: Trump's oil tanker seizure raises questions about potential Venezuela blockade
item.description: Donald Trump's assertions on foreign policy since his return to the White House have literally stretched from one end of the Western Hemisphere to the other.

item.title: Greg Lynn successfully appealed his Victorian High Country murder conviction. What happens now?
item.description: Prosecutors in Greg Lynn's Victorian High Country murder trial are preparing for a second trial after the Court of Appeal quashed his conviction.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A furious bidding war, hilarious animals and the Ashes
item.description: A lot happened in news this week. Did you take it all in?

item.title: Today in History, December 12: Australian dollar floated amid financial chaos
item.description: It was a pivotal moment in the nation's history, forever changing the way we were governed and the way in which we interacted with the rest of the world.

item.title: NSW guidelines proposed to prevent hospitals from refusing abortion care based on personal beliefs
item.description: Hospital managers and executives in NSW will be barred from blocking abortions because of moral and religious views, according to a document obtained by the ABC.

item.title: After opposing the Coalition's 'robo' NDIS reforms, Labor accused of going down similar path
item.description: The finer details of a new NDIS planning system are yet to be finalised, but it's already drawing comparisons to failed Coalition-era reforms, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

item.title: Brisbane Racing Club under fire as members allege conflicts of interest and governance failures
item.description: Members of Queensland's richest horse racing club are demanding answers after they discovered its former chairman struck a lucrative deal with the developer of its luxury residential precinct while he had oversight of the $850 million project.

item.title: Albanese's social media ban is bold reform, but it will take years to judge its real success
item.description: Parents will thank the government for giving them more agency in dealing with the social media issue but kids aren't voters and it is hard to see the issue deciding votes either way.

item.title: Bendigo Writers Festival council report recommends one-year hiatus amid reputational damage
item.description: Council officers recommend a one-year hiatus for the Bendigo Writers Festival to work on repairing the reputation of the event.

item.title: Labor tries to end Ashton Hurn's 'honeymoon' early
item.description: Only days after taking her party's top job, Liberal leader Ashton Hurn is under pressure on a key election promise.

item.title: Bathurst mother Emma Mason's advocacy for social media ban piques interests of global leaders and media
item.description: Bathurst mother and lawyer Emma Mason's advocacy for Australia's social media ban has always been in honour of her late daughter, Tilly.

item.title: Calls for vending machines in hospitals after women denied period products
item.description: When Samantha Bruce got her period in hospital she wasn't able to get a pad or tampon. She says the response left her feeling "small and dehumanised".

item.title: How schools of excellence are changing the future of girls rugby league in Queensland
item.description: A growing rugby league excellence program is helping change the future of Queensland girls.

item.title: Families grapple with results of review into systemic failings that enabled paedophile Ashley Paul Griffith
item.description: Ashley Paul Griffith was sentenced to life in prison last year for sexually abusing 69 girls at childcare centres in Brisbane and Italy over a two-decade period.

item.title: Landlords eligible for $3,500 rebates for putting rooftop solar on rentals under Queensland scheme
item.description: The $26 million pre-election commitment from the LNP is estimated by the government to save 6,500 households around $700 on energy bills, with applications opening on Friday morning.

item.title: How 'snakeheads' are redirecting illegal migration from China toward Australia
item.description: Recent boat arrivals in Western Australia offer a glimpse into how routes through South-East Asia, particularly Indonesia, are being used to reach Australia.

item.title: Why the football Dylan Brown showed for New Zealand can make his record-breaking move to Newcastle pay off
item.description: The football Dylan Brown played for New Zealand should have won him the Golden Boot but it could also be the key to his record-breaking move to Newcastle.

item.title: Australian rare earth processing plant to be ready for use in 2026
item.description: The processing market is dominated by China, but Australia is building its capabilities in an attempt to boost the domestic industry.

item.title: Federal politics live: Tomago smelter to stay open post 2028 in federal government power deal
item.description: Anthony Albanese has declared the government has reached a deal to keep the Tomago aluminium smelter running until 2028. Follow live.

item.title: Police Commissioner Grant Stevens appointed to Adelaide Football Club board
item.description: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

item.title: NSW prison watchdog calls to shut parts of Sydney's Long Bay Jail
item.description: The NSW's prisons watchdog has deemed parts of Long Bay Jail "unsafe" and "dilapidated" and "incapable of providing safe and humane" conditions.

item.title: Perth Scorchers into WBBL final as Beth Mooney continues sparkling form to down Sydney Sixers
item.description: Sydney Sixers keeper Alyssa Healy misses a glorious chance to dismiss Beth Mooney, and the Aussie left-hander makes her pay big-time with a sparkling innings.

item.title: Markets live update: ANZ to defend legal action by former boss over $13.5m in lost bonuses, ASX surging
item.description: Former ANZ chief executive Shayne Elliott is suing the bank for stripping him of $13.5 million in bonuses. Local stocks are rallying after the Dow hit new records in a mixed session for Wall Street overnight. Follow live.

item.title: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright is expected to be sentenced today. Here's what you need to know
item.description: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright was earlier this year found guilty on two counts of attempting to pervert the course of justice. Today, the court will consider his sentence.

item.title: Independent wholesaler cautiously welcomes review into outback food subsidy scheme
item.description: A wholesaler hopes a review of a controversial outback food subsidy scheme will be independent and transparent.

item.title: After 40 years of plot twists and drama, Neighbours wraps up for the last time — again
item.description: Relive the highlights, such as they were, in the final episode of Neighbours, which went to air last night.

item.title: Demersal fishing ban leaves industry 'drowning' as mental health concerns rise
item.description: WA fishers are raising concerns about a lack of mental health support as the commercial industry comes to terms with a ban on demersal fishing.

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing, Tyler Robinson, makes first in-court appearance
item.description: Lawyers for Tyler Robinson, the man accused of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, have sought to limit media access to ensure a fair trial.

item.title: Donald Trump says land strikes on Venezuela drug shipments coming soon
item.description: Donald Trump says the US will soon strike drug shipments making their way from Venezuela on land, amid a large-scale military build-up in the southern Caribbean to increase pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.

item.title: FIFA World Cup ticket prices leave fans fuming and claiming 'monumental betrayal'
item.description: A fans organisation lashes out at "extortionate" prices for tickets at next year's FIFA World Cup despite claims from the footballing body that the tournament would be affordable.

item.title: Record-breaking crocodile Cassius taxidermied for Green Island exhibit
item.description: The world's largest crocodile in captivity until its death last year is going on display in Far North Queensland, as more findings are revealed about its cause of death.

item.title: Hailstorm batters western NSW as homes destroyed in bushfire
item.description: Hailstorms have damaged homes in parts of western NSW as the cost of nearby bushfires continues to mount.

item.title: Melbourne's West Gate Tunnel 'ready to take cars from Sunday'
item.description: After being plagued by cost blowouts and delays, Melbourne's West Gate Tunnel will be ready to take motor vehicles from Sunday, say multiple sources.

item.title: Community rallies around family of farmer Mark Mudie after bushfire death
item.description: In the wake of the tragic loss of farmer Mark Mudie while fighting a bushfire, the community has rallied to help his family finish harvesting.

item.title: Matilda Bay and Applecross ferry terminals approved in Swan River Metronet plan
item.description: WA's planning authorities approve the construction of two new ferry terminals at Applecross and Matilda Bay as part of the state government's expansion of Swan River ferry services.

item.title: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic labelled 'smug' by US great Landon Donovan for reaction at FIFA World Cup draw
item.description: America's consensus greatest ever player takes issue with the Socceroos coach's reaction to drawing USA, tipping Australia to finish last in its World Cup group.

item.title: Eurovision winner Nemo returns trophy in protest over Israel's participation in competition
item.description: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

item.title: Reddit files legal challenge against social media ban for under-16s
item.description: Reddit has filed a High Court challenge alleging that Australia's social media restrictions are being applied to the company inaccurately.

item.title: Principal Anita Haley says cancelling the formal was never a thought
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: After a century on the AM band, ABC Radio stations in Perth will move to FM in 2026
item.description: Almost 102 years after ABC radio first hit the airwaves, Perth listeners will experience a major improvement in audio quality when the network's three AM stations move to FM in 2026.

item.title: Career counselling lacking as students try to predict AI impact on jobs of the future
item.description: A Victorian Parliamentary Inquiry report finds youth career support is "severely lacking" as students fear AI is threatening white-collar industries.

item.title: Treasurer Jim Chalmers gives green light to Hanwha's double stake in shipbuilder Austal
item.description: Jim Chalmers said there will be "strict conditions" on the South Korean defence conglomerate's stake in the strategic shipbuilder, in a nod to the diplomatic and security sensitivities surrounding the bid.

item.title: Asbestos-containing wind turbine brake pad shipment docked at Geelong port
item.description: A cargo ship containing asbestos products is docked at the port of Geelong in Victoria's south-west.

item.title: Follow live: Last of Us creators take jab at 'streaming overlords' in Game Awards acceptance speech
item.description: The biggest night in gaming is getting underway in the heart of downtown Los Angeles. Follow along in our live blog.

item.title: Sydney out-of-school-hours care worker David James pleads guilty to child abuse offences
item.description: A former Sydney out-of-school-hours care worker has pleaded guilty to producing and possessing child abuse material and committing sexual acts against children while filming.

item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza gameplay footage
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Price gap between metro and regional energy bills drives push from NSW councils for 'fairer' prices
item.description: Regional ratepayers are shouldering higher energy bills than their city counterparts, and their councils have had enough.

item.title: Judge grants bail for Sydney men after pack-rape convictions quashed
item.description: Maurice Hawell and Andrew David, both 31, had been convicted of multiple counts of aggravated sexual assault and aggravated sexual touching in company, following a joint trial in the District Court last year.

item.title: Hollywood director Carl Rinsch convicted of scamming Netflix out of $16.5m
item.description: Carl Erik Rinsch is convicted on charges that he scammed Netflix out of $US11 million for a show that never materialised, instead using the cash for purchases including luxury cars and homewares.

item.title: Perth fires prompt warning of extreme conditions as Kenwick, Bullsbrook blazes downgraded
item.description: Extreme fire conditions are expected in Perth over the weekend with temperatures forecast to reach 40 degrees Celsius, as firefighters try to bring two bushfires in the city's north-east and south-east under control.

item.title: Domestic violence royal commission prompts $674 million response
item.description: The South Australian government has committed more than $600 million over a decade to reduce the prevalence of — and protect the victims of — domestic, family and sexual violence, in response to a landmark royal commission earlier this year.

item.title: New SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn unveils 'streamlined' shadow cabinet
item.description: South Australia's new Liberal leader Ashton Hurn unveils a "streamlined" shadow cabinet, just 99 days out from the next state election.

item.title: St Helens student arrives for formal in boat
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Stieglitz bushfire not enough to stop students and teachers from holding year 10 formal
item.description: Tasmanian students and teachers of St Helens District High School defy the Stieglitz bushfire to rescue formal wear, assemble decorations and food and hold their year 10 formal.

item.title: How long does it take to fix an underperforming school?
item.description: A Queensland high school has re-engaged students by embedding agriculture into the curriculum and building strong local industry ties.

item.title: PM says he has asked independent watchdog for advice on politician entitlement rules
item.description: Sports and Communications Minister Anika Wells referred her claims to the Independent Parliamentary Expenses Authority for review after a stream of questions over her spending earlier this week.

item.title: What does the US proposal that foreign tourists disclose social media information mean for Australians?
item.description: Mean tweets about US policy might mean no trip to Disneyland, under a new proposal that would see Australians provide their social media history for the past five years.

item.title: SA Premier Malinauskas accepts DV Royal Commission recommendations
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Surfers capture weird wave
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Surfers find 'earthquake wave' off Western Australia's remote south coast
item.description: A natural phenomenon leaves surfers in awe of the "earthquake" wave.

item.title: Why has Bulgaria's government resigned after anti-corruption protests across the country?
item.description: Bulgaria's prime minister announced the decision in a televised address saying "ahead of today's vote of no confidence, the government is resigning".

item.title: Dicky Bill salad farm's $10m debt shock as creditors try to claw back millions
item.description: Administrators for failed Australian salad farm company Dicky Bill reveal its business debts to hundreds of staff and suppliers could exceed $10 million.
